thread.title: Avalanche Rescue Dog Unwinds By Sliding Down Mountain Slope
thread.title_full: Avalanche Rescue Dog Unwinds By Sliding Down Mountain Slope

author: Reshareworthy Editorial Team
title: Avalanche Rescue Dog Unwinds By Sliding Down Mountain Slope
text:
Avalanche Rescue Dog Unwinds By Sliding Down Mountain Slope   
An avalanche rescue dog was caught on video showing how he likes to relax and unwind after a hard day’s work on the slopes of Heavenly Mountain ski resort in South Lake Tahoe, California. 
Truckee, the 6-year-old Labrador Retriever, is the senior dog of the mountain’s Avalanche Rescue Dog Program, and simply loves to have fun in the snow. In this case, he made an epic 200-foot slide down the hill and loved ever minute of it! 
His handler and human, Chris Child, skiied after him and caught the dog’s joyous slide on video, and the video is now going viral. “He slides like this occasionally, when he’s hot or just for fun,” said ski patroller Chris Child. “This was probably his longest slide so far, and I was lucky to get it on camera.” 
I think Truckee deserves every minute of fun he can get, given the job he has. 
Check out Truckee letting loose and having some fun and share it with your friends!
